node.text: @primo_art_club 🤗
@rovingtreasures ♥️♥️

Teaching diversity is one of the ways I hope to help my children understand that the world is a fabric of people so different - that we think, look and behave differently, but we are all interconnected by a common need for love.
.
🌿This was our moment this morning, when we read about Helen Keller - my little girl could not fully understand the extent of Helen’s disabilities but she knew Helen was different.
.
🌿At some point, sadness crept in and we had to pause to let her share about that discomfort.
.
She loved so much, the story of Helen’s grit, that she made me read it thrice. And as I got our next activity ready, she kept herself occupied by trying to sketch a picture of Helen Keller.
.
We played a quick blindfold activity to help her experience what it felt to rely only on the sense of touch. I realize that this is also a fun way to refine her stereognostic sense and visual memory - definitely doing it again 😉.
.
I really enjoyed watching her manipulating the objects, describing the textures and guessing what they were.
.
🌿 Totally unplanned and wonderfully led by my child who wondered how it was like for Helen when she lost her sight.
.
🕊 "It is time for parents to teach young people early on that in diversity there is beauty and there is strength." ~ Maya Angelou
.
.
.

@possum.at.play thank you! The blindfold activity was spontaneous but fun!
I love the opportunity you’ve taken to pause and explore those feelings as you read the book together, and the blindfold activity that followed!

@theplayjournals aww thank you. We picked this book randomly as it was on the shelf when I checked out at the lib. Didn’t expect to enjoy it so much and I think it gonna look for more books of similar genre now!
So beautifully written about the need to teach our kids diversity! I love how the extended activities naturally unfolded. She must have gained so much from these experiences! So good, mama!
@talk_and_play_mama thank you, mama. It was quite an unexpected lesson and I’m glad we read this book
Such a beautiful activity for teaching about diversity ❤️
@learnandbloom thank you, it was a surprise pick from the library and I’m glad I brought it home. Gonna find similar books from the bookshops soon!
What a great book to discuss diversity together 😊
@valueaddedparenting thank you! I hope to raise them kind and accepting, towards themselves and others alike♥️
Loved this read. The world needs more people who are thoughtful and empathic - clearly you are consciously trying to raise these qualities in yours. 💕
@life.with.moon.and.co indeed!
What a fabulous way to teach about diversity
@gumnut_music thank you 🤗
Wow. This is just beautiful. This play was so in tune with your daughters needs.
@today.our.children !
@today.our.children thank you, Kristy! I cannot wait you read more of these books w her!
Sounds like a beautiful way to teach diversity?
@pippilearns thank you.. it means so much to me! I’m so motivated to get more books from this series cuz they are so easy to read

What an interesting lesson to be learnt! I have just finished an unit in my course called “Work with diverse people” and I will save my course book and one day I am definitely talking to my girl about it. Soon. And soo saving your post! 👍👏
@rovingtreasures ♥️♥️
What a beautiful book to be reading and what a great way to learn about diversity!
@primo_art_club 🤗
Beautiful ❤️
@mummy_andus2 it is!
This book looks brilliant to learn about accepting others
@play_with_aj thank you!
Oh I love this! I bet you’re doing an amazing job at that too!
@littlebutloud.co 🤗
What a great teaching ! Simply beautiful ❤️
@atwinkleintheireyes thank you Des
Clever mama to teach this! So wise
